climbs.name: Crack of Doom
climbs.fa: Harlin Brandvold, Nick Hindley, Duncan Pawson (August 2019)

content.description:
Start up the lieback flake to a ledge (10a). Trend left over easy terrain to a splitter finger/tips crack on vertical terrain. The crack has not been freed yet. We would love if someone sent it. We estimate it's 5.13- but aren't sure. It is very clean.

Same approach as for Riders of Rohan except do not traverse to the south side of the wall. The climb is on the west facing wall and is obvious as soon as you reach the buttress.
SR to 3". Triples from 0.2-0.3". Nuts.

Pitch 1 - 5.8

Follow the left corner up to a bushy ledge, then onto a flake before finishing left of a roof pulling trees until you're on top of First Ledge. Tree belay. Can be skipped via a low 5th gully to the right.

Pitch 2 - 5.8

Climb the face left of the obvious corner. Scrambling up cracks and shelves until you reach Crescent Ledge. Tree belay.

Pitch 3 - 5.9

Move the belay to the far left of Crescent Ledge climbing over a large boulder along the way. Scramble up a corner with horizontal cracks on its right side to a small ledge. Follow blocky twin cracks up and left. Once on the ledge scramble up and left to a tree belay that resembles the Watcher of the Mines of Moria (an octopus). 

Pitch 4 - 5.7

Pull up low-angle blocks and ledges to the top.

Tree raps to the ground.



Walk from the hut along the trail, and turn left towards Shadowfax. A half dead tree marks where we entered the wooded area that guards the first pitch.

Tree Belays

climbs.name: Riders of Rohan
climbs.fa: Harlin Brandvold, Nick Hindley, Duncan Pawson (August 2019)

content.description:
P1 - Follow the left trending corner into the first crack system. Follow this to the big ledge with two boulders stacked on one another. Belay here. 10c.

P2 - Move the belay up and over the boulders to the next ledge on the left. Begin up the bushy crack system trending right onto the face. Climb up past one bolt into a difficult groove. Clip the second bolt at the crux and continue straight up past two more bolts to a belay at a ledge. Save a 0.2 for after the second bolt - bit spicy. It's nice to have thin gear for the belay (ball nuts work well if you got them). 11a.

P3 - Traverse left to the arete and follow it up. Good pro. Belay on or just before the massive ledge. Can scramble to the top from here. 5.8.

Descent:  Rap 30m from a big dying tree to a large sideways tree on the west face. Rap another 60m to the ground over Crack of Doom. Likely possible to do an intermediate rap from another tree or from the anchor of Crack of Doom if you don't have two ropes.

From the hut, head east to the second of two buttresses off Mt Shadowfax (this is east sub-summit of Mt Shadowfax). Head north up the gully until you hit the wall (climber's right). Crack of Doom is immediately there on the west facing wall. For Riders, traverse to the south side of the wall along a goat trail. The route starts with a layback in a corner beside a 'V' chimney. If you squeeze past a tree and the wall you've gone too far (the climb is just before this).
SR to 4". Doubles from 0.2 to 1". Nuts. Ball nuts if you have them.
Climbs on Mt. Shadowfax - the peak immediately east of the Brian Waddington hut.
